title-group.subtitle: A Healthy Initiative in Monmouth County, New Jersey

contrib-group.aff: Health Occupations Instructor, Boone Career & Technical Center, Foster, WV

abstract.p: School nurses are diligent guardians of children’s health. Health promotion is becoming more and more difficult due to the increase in childhood obesity across the nation. Bold new strategies must be undertaken to reverse this alarming trend. School nurses in New Jersey teamed up with local health departments and the Medical Reserve Corps to implement a creative approach to this problem.

ack.p: Many thanks to Tracey Smith, program officer, Division of the Civilian Volunteer Medical Reserve Corps, Office of the U.S. Surgeon General, for her support and assistance in the development of this article.

bio.p: Paula’s career in nursing spans 28 years and includes 2 years as a school nurse. She works closely with School Health Services to promote health and wellness in the students of Boone County Schools.
